verses.verse: Ephraim <WH669> feedeth<WH7462> on wind<WH7307>, and followeth<WH7291> after the east wind<WH6921>: he continually<WH3117> multiplieth<WH7235> lies<WH3577> and desolation<WH7701>; and they make<WH3772> a covenant<WH1285> with Assyria<WH804>, and oil<WH8081> is carried<WH2986> into Egypt<WH4714>.

Jehovah <WH3068> hath also a controversy<WH7379> with Judah<WH3063>, and will punish<WH6485> Jacob<WH3290> according to his ways<WH1870>; according to his doings<WH4611> will he recompense him<WH7725>.
In the womb<WH990> he took his brother<WH251> by the heel<WH6117>; and in his manhood<WH202> he had power<WH8280> with God<WH430>:

yea <WH7786>, he had power over the angel<WH4397>, and prevailed<WH3201>; he wept<WH1058>, and made supplication<WH2603> unto him<WH4672>: he found him at Beth-el<WH1008>, and there he spake with us<WH1696>,
even Jehovah<WH3068>, the God<WH430> of hosts<WH6635>; Jehovah<WH3068> is his memorial name<WH2143>.
Therefore turn<WH7725> thou to thy God<WH430>: keep<WH8104> kindness<WH2617> and justice<WH4941>, and wait<WH6960> for thy God<WH430> continually<WH8548>.
He is a trafficker<WH3667>, the balances<WH3976> of deceit<WH4820> are in his hand<WH3027>: he loveth<WH157> to oppress<WH6231>.

And Ephraim<WH669> said<WH559>, Surely I am become rich<WH6238>, I have found me<WH4672> wealth<WH202>: in all my labors<WH3018> they shall find<WH4672> in me no iniquity<WH5771> that were sin<WH2399>.
But I am Jehovah<WH3068> thy God<WH430> from the land<WH776> of Egypt<WH4714>; I will yet again make thee to dwell<WH3427> in tents<WH168>, as in the days<WH3117> of the solemn feast<WH4150>.
I have also spoken<WH1696> unto the prophets<WH5030>, and I have multiplied<WH7235> visions<WH2377>; and by the ministry<WH3027> of the prophets<WH5030> have I used similitudes<WH1819>.

Is Gilead<WH1568> iniquity<WH205>? they are altogether false<WH7723>; in Gilgal<WH1537> they sacrifice<WH2076> bullocks<WH7794>; yea<WH4196>, their altars are as heaps<WH1530> in the furrows<WH8525> of the field<WH7704>.
And Jacob<WH3290> fled<WH1272> into the field<WH7704> of Aram<WH758>, and Israel<WH3478> served<WH5647> for a wife<WH802>, and for a wife<WH802> he kept sheep<WH8104>.
And by a prophet<WH5030> Jehovah<WH3068> brought<WH5927> Israel<WH3478> up out of Egypt<WH4714>, and by a prophet<WH5030> was he preserved<WH8104>.

Ephraim <WH669> hath provoked to anger<WH3707> most bitterly<WH8563>: therefore shall his blood<WH1818> be left<WH5203> upon him<WH2781>, and his reproach shall his Lord<WH113> return unto him<WH7725>.
